It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and rocky terrains. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cephaelis pebasensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
